I came up with a headcanon a while back regarding age.

They have growing seasons where they get really greedy and their size grows in proportion to their hoard.
Size of their hoard by the end of the season 'locks in' their size until the next season.
Their actual age is told through their wing span.

A big dragon with tiny wings = a young dragon that got lucky or is skilled at defending and collecting stuff.
A small dragon with big wings = an old dragon thats unlucky or shit at being a dragon.

Wings are an inherent advantage even if its just in moving away from fuckers who will steal your hoard so you'll average out to equilibrium over time.

Sign ups close at 11:59pm CT on the 30th of November, no exceptions!

Nov the past: Gift assignments out. Card assignments out.

Contact for questions about any card issues: thecardslut@gmail.com

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.sub: Rainbow Dash is Too Much of a Tomboy
threads.com:
The idea that Sunset and Applejack are as masculine as Rainbow Dash is laughable. They are much more mellow and have much more feminine traits so that their friendships with the others still feels natural, they doesn't come off as the token tomboy like Rainbow Dash does.

Rainbow Dash has the personality of a typical loud male jock and yet she is friends with feminine girls who have completely different temperaments and interests than her. She has never been shown with tomboy or male friends that have her type of temperament. She comes off as a forced token tomboy character. Like really, they couldn't give her a single male friend? She has the masculine temperament of guys, so it seems like she would have definitely have male friends. Heck, she acts a lot more like your average male than your average female.

Where are her friends that are not vastly different from her? I'm not even necessarily asking for the same interests, just for a similar temperment. The rest of them are all chill normies in spite of varying interests while Rainbow is just alone as the loud brash hyper dude bro. And yet she magically is on the same footing as the rest as best friends, and appears to have no other close friends. If you had a jock friend who acted like Rainbow Dash but is a male, would you be able to see them as best friends with people with the mane six's temperment? Of course not.

In a real life setting like high school or college, what group of people could you more naturally see Rainbow Dash hanging out and bonding with: A group of brash, mascaline troublemakers (whether male or tomboys) who are athletic and enjoy screwing around, or the feminine safe mane six? You know the answer to this question deep down in spite of all the mental gymnastics you use to deny it. The Mane Six are too attitudinally safe and unfun for her. Her placement in the show is forced and has always been forced. But people don't care because they like tomboys. Which is fair enough, but you still gotta acknowledge this blatant flaw even if it does not personally bother you.

last_replies.com:
I haven't written anything since highschool. Out of curiosity I searched my old pastebin in the archives and found someone posted story a year after I stopped. It wasn't particularly popular or good. I am overwhelmed with emotions right now.

Why did you keep writing? How did you? Do you miss it if you stopped?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>39348817
Anon, even if you're not popular, people still liked your story, and sometimes people probably even think back to it on occasion.

I wrote because I was inspired to, and writing is a passion of mine. I also liked to see what people thought about my writing, and how I could improve on it with their feedback, even if it was harsh sometimes. I haven't written consistently for some time, and I do miss it, but hopefully I can get myself in a routine and maybe write something for the board again sometime. Writing is just the effort you put into it, you write by opening a word document or text editor and put words on the screen, editing them until they're good enough to share.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>39349244
I don't know if I miss writing or just miss the attention from threads. I don't know if I'm invested in anything anymore that doesn't give me some kind of attention. Seeing the view count on the story made me happy so many people read my story, sad that I stopped, angry at myself for thinking so vainly and shallow. This is the strongest I've felt about anything in a long time and part of that makes me feel stupid. Even now I feel like a terrible person just talking about myself so much but I feel like this is the only place I can have a breakdown. I don't even know if I could write again or what about. I just wish I never stopped now.

threads.com:
Howdy, partner!

What you see here began as a series of comedy-centric stories with the concept of an alicorn-ascended Princess Applejack trying to change a mismanaged Equestria for the better by humorously interacting with the other, quite lazy, princesses. Plus late night pink antics.

Not to mention a whole bunch of Changelings with nothing better to do but cause mischief.


The whole thing was set in motion by this gem:

~~~~~

>So, wait, why am Ah' a princess again?

>Because you seem to be the only goddamn one of those ponies who gets that a Princess need to do actual work regarding maintenance of the kingdom. You know how much city planning or trade negotiations Twilight or Luna have done? Fucking nothing. Everyone is obsessed with the world ending threats they think I should fight, but the minute I point out the free health care I have to work to maintain everyone goes quiet. And don't even get me started on Cadence, who can't even manage a basic meeting with the Equestrian Games representative. Fucking annoying. Go do actual princess stuff, because apparently everyone else got the pamphlets mixed up or something and thinks "Princess" means "Beat cop."

~~~~~

Are you feeling creative? Try your hand at writing a story! No contribution is too small and we love having new folks around.

If you're more artistically inclined give a drawing or sketch a shot. Don't fret too much; it doesn't have to be fancy and we appreciate artwork a lot.

If that isn't your style either, writers always need feedback. So tell us what you liked - and what you didn't - to help us improve.

If you are unsure about anything, do not be afraid to ask. We will gladly bring you up-to-date or explain anything you feel is unclear.

Thread 354, and we've got turkey galore!

>What is Flutterrape?
Flutterrape is a collection of stories about ponies trying and failing to have sex with Anon, the only human in Equestria. While the title implies that it is Fluttershy trying to rape Anon, others may follow in her stead and attempt their own versions of rape. There are different versions of Flutterrape, but most are light-hearted comedies about the ponies failing in their attempts to get into Anon’s pants. Just because your story has Anon in it, doesn't mean it fits in this thread. Check other threads (AiE, RGRE etc) about story content before posting.

>It's been 10 years, how is this thread still alive?
A perverse mixture of necromancy and spite.

>How do I start writing?
Use your imagination, you nitwit. Additionally, brush up on your grammar and abandon your standards.

>"So, I'm late?" she says at last.

>You've still not really looked at her, and turn to the next page in your book.
>"Were you scared at leas..." She sighs. "You're not scared."
"Nah. Zombies are old-hat where I'm from. Might have worked thirty years ago, though."

threads.name: Anonymous
threads.com:
This will be deleted so it'll be quick. Today's an exceptionally special day as it marks 10 years since Milky Way's Tumblr started. The tumblr is now age-restricted but you can view the posts here starting from the back: https://www.tumbex.com/milkmare-of-trottingham.tumblr/posts?page=10

Milky's special talent quickly gained the blog over 1400 watchers in less than two weeks. It was especially embraced on /mlp/ where the thread generated several times more content than the tumblr which was only in its second day: https://desuarchive.org/mlp/thread/5678650/#q5678650 Milky had a continuous presence for months afterwards as a general thread.

Fast forward to May 2013 and it was on its 71st general thread: https://desuarchive.org/mlp/thread/10866090/#q10866090 The thread was deleted early and the incident shrugged off, but unbeknownst to them it was right before some of the most eventful days in /mlp/ history. Lauren Faust would visit /mlp/ a few days later https://desuarchive.org/mlp/chunk/10902082/ and all hell broke loose, even prompting a reply from Moot (https://desuarchive.org/mlp/chunk/10902082/500/3/#q10906860). But attention quickly turned to "The Scruffening", a mass deletion of various threads and general confusion over the following days. Milky Way threads were quickly deleted from then on, later confirmed as bannable content due to its NSFW nature: https://desuarchive.org/q/thread/640332/#q641855 Some claimed that Lauren's visit sparked the sudden SFW enforcement but this remains inconclusive.

Milky Way threads have occasionally been posted over the years, lasting only a few minutes to several hours at a time. While the blog's creator remains active (https://twitter.com/FlashEquestria), the blog itself hasn't had a new post in a year.

Not expecting a discussion here. This one's for the archives.

Welcome to the Pony Voice Preservation Project!
youtu.be/730zGRwbQuE

The Pony Preservation Project is a collaborative effort by /mlp/ to build and curate pony datasets for as many applications in AI as possible.

Technology has progressed such that a trained neural network can generate convincing voice clips, drawings and text for any person or character using existing audio recordings, artwork and fanfics as a reference. As you can surely imagine, AI pony voices, drawings and text have endless applications for pony content creation.

AI is incredibly versatile, basically anything that can be boiled down to a simple dataset can be used for training to create more of it. AI-generated images, fanfics, wAIfu chatbots and even animation are possible, and are being worked on here.

Any anon is free to join, and there are many active tasks that would suit any level of technical expertise. If you’re interested in helping out, take a look at the quick start guide linked below and ask in the thread for any further detail you need.

EQG and G5 are not welcome.

The show had quite a few different intelligent species by season 8, 'everycreature' and all. Pick your poison, but /mlp/ is mainly into ponies.
